intro: Dipoma iberideum, commonly known as the Iberian dipoma, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native range.
